In an unexpected announcement, Google CEO Eric Schmidt has announced that as of today he will be stepping down from the captain's chair and will be replaced by co-founder Larry Page. official blog, Eric Schmidt said When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. He also added, "Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer

But just one month after Pop Idol premiered in 2001, the tabloid Sunday People zeroed in on Simon Cowell under the headline WOMEN FANS FALL FOR MR. NASTY. The record boss is being chased by besotted women wanting to get to know him better-despite his sarcastic comments and cutting remarks to young wannabes on the hit ITV talent show. As his public profile rose, Simon Cowell took action to manage his image. Over 40 when Pop Idol began, Simon Cowell had had a handful of semipublic romances with singers and model types.
